parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To know, consider, be privy to.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: From dikaios; to render just or innocent.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From ana and krino; properly, to scrutinize, i.e. investigate, interrogate, determine.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
